related words: 1. هُمْ becomes هُمُ before the definite article الـ. 2. Specifically
ـيَ is attached to nouns. In the latter case
ـيَ is attached to nouns whose construct state ends in a long vowel
while ـِي is attached to nouns whose construct state ends in a short vowel
in which case that vowel is elided. Furthermore
-ū of the masculine sound plural is assimilated to -ī before ـيَ. Prepositions use ـِي
even though in this case it has the meaning of rather than . The sisters of inna can use either form. 3. ـهِـ occurs after -i
